website_summaries.verdict: Inexpensive teaching dental model, and it's small enough to approximate a child's mouth.
pros: Lightweight and small set of dental teeth that can easily be taken with you anywhere
Teeth are fixed tightly into the model, so children can practice brushing on it without damaging any of the teeth
cons: Hinge on the jaws doesn't open very wide, so teaching brushing is awkward

customer_reviews.title: nice to teach kids how to brush
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to teach my kid how to properly brush his teeth. For the price I paid, I am extremely pleased with the product. The teeth do not have spaces between them to allow floss to slide between them. So in this respect they aren't entirely accurate, but they are close enough to for kids to get the picture.
customer_reviews.author: yappity y.

customer_reviews.title: Nicely made! Good quality at a reasonable price!
customer_reviews.text: This model was ideal for my husband’s lesson on oral hygiene. The price was right & the kids enjoyed seeing the model, studying it & learning how to brush the teeth properly! It came quickly & was on time. I would recommend its use for an elementary or middle school classroom!
customer_reviews.author: Jonispin

customer_reviews.title: With the model she has become more comfortable and accepting of brushing her teeth
customer_reviews.text: I have a special needs child who has a hard time with the concept of brushing teeth. With the model she has become more comfortable and accepting of brushing her teeth. She even practices on the model. I think it’s helped her to understand by having the visual in front of her. Very happy with this. Sturdy enough for her rough handling.
customer_reviews.author: Ninfa

customer_reviews.title: It's great!
customer_reviews.text: Teaching my toddler how to brush teeth. I had a genius idea. And this product opens perfectly in width. It's great!
customer_reviews.author: SaraLee728

customer_reviews.title: I remember these from when it was a novelty toy ...
customer_reviews.text: I remember these from when it was a novelty toy, now my daughter used it for Dental assisting school.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My two year old granddaughter loves playing dentist with these choppers!
customer_reviews.author: C. DuMat

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I use this product to study for dental assisting school. It’s exactly what I needed to study the teeth numbers. The only thing to be aware of is that it doesn’t show the wisdom teeth. Overall, a very good product for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Dental care teaching tool
customer_reviews.text: This has been used in my school's nursing programs. Great demonstration tool.
customer_reviews.author: Veta U. Nakai

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for instructing young children, esp with developmental disabilities to independently brush their teeth thoroughly.
customer_reviews.author: Sped mom

customer_reviews.title: I received what I saw in the picture.
customer_reviews.text: Daughter used product for her dentistry classes. Very useful and good price
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to show my kids how to brush their teeth. It comes in handy.
customer_reviews.author: LJAY

customer_reviews.title: Just started out as a DH student. I'm a ...
customer_reviews.text: Just started out as a DH student. I'm a visual learner so this has helped tremendously with studying the anatomy and numbers of the teeth.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not great quality
customer_reviews.text: Cheap made. I’m a dental instructor and it’s not the best quality for everyday use but could work well for a school project.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Fullerton

customer_reviews.title: Good teaching tool
customer_reviews.text: Good teaching tool, but it's missing the third molars, aka wisdom teeth, that it necessary for learning the number system of the teeth.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Rigdon

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: The drew caps kept falling off the end and the whole thing will fall apart
customer_reviews.author: Bowers

customer_reviews.title: Can't floss
customer_reviews.text: There is no space between the teeth to teach kids how to floss. But... clearly they are teeth and can be brushed for practice and demonstration.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie J. Liebman

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this product for 2 months and the screw piece came off and I am unable to place it back on. I used this for my adolescent kids who have a toothbrushing goal and make sure it is handled properly. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline
